title: Brit teen who fell to his death from 7th floor flat on school exchange trip pictured
text:

This is the tragic 15-year-old Brit who died after plunging from a seventh-floor apartment in Spain.

Max McMullen was trying to fix a broken blind at the bathroom of his school exchange trip's host family on Saturday night.

But the teenager fell in what is being described as a tragic accident in Cordoba, southern Spain.

Max, who attended Beechen Cliff School in Bath, Somerset, had been out for a hamburger with the host's family just hours before, it has emerged.

The young athlete played for Bath Rugby Academy and Walcot Rugby Club, which said it is not commenting to give his family "some space" to grieve.

Inmaculada Troncoso, the education chief in Cordoba, said: "We deeply regret what has happened.

"We are offering support to the school where the boy was as well as his family."

Andrew Davies, the head teacher at Beechen Cliff, wrote to parents on Sunday confirming the "very sad news of the sudden death of a Beechen Cliff School year 11 pupil".

The letter said bereavement counsellors would be at the school and "will be available for as long as they are required".

Assemblies "about the tragic incident" were held on Monday, according to reports.

A secretary at the academy, which is a day and boarding school for boys with a co-educational sixth form, said that it was not commenting. Calls were passed on to the Midsomer Norton Schools’ Partnership multi-academy trust.

Alun Williams, chief executive of the trust, said: "It has been reported to the school and the trust that a tragic incident has occurred during a school exchange visit. At this point we do not have any further details and we are working closely with the local authority and other authorities."

The Medina Azahara secondary school, which is near the flat where Max was staying, confirmed he had been attending classes there last week.

(Image: Getty Images)

A spokesman for the emergency services said: "A 15-year-old youngster has died in Cordoba after falling from a seventh-floor bathroom window. We were alerted around 11.25pm [on Saturday] to say a person had fallen from a window at an apartment block in Calle Periodista Quesada Chacon.

"Emergency services including police and medical responders were alerted but the youngster was already dead when they arrived following what police have indicated was an accidental fall.”

A police spokesman in Cordoba said: "There doesn’t appear to be any signs of criminality or evidence pointing to the involvement of anyone else.”

The Foreign Office said: "We are supporting the family of a British child who died following an incident in Cordoba in Spain."
description: Max McMullen, who attended Beechen Cliff School in Bath, Somerset and played for Walcot Rugby Club, fell at the apartment in Cordoba, southern Spain
